item.title: Personalized Decision Making - A Conceptual Introduction (Scott Mueller and Judea Pearl)
item.description: Abstract This paper clarifies the distinction between personalized decision making, which targets the behavurir of a specific individual, population-based decision making, which concerns a sub-population resembling that individual, explains why personalized decision making leads to more informed dicisions. The authors argued that combining experimental and observational studies can obtain valuable information about individual behavior, improve decisions over those obtained from experimental studies alone. 1.
